title: US Says All Venezuela Sanctions Are on Table If Maduro Reneges
description: The Biden administration is prepared to revoke all licenses recently awarded to Venezuela if Nicolás Maduro doesn’t present a path toward fairer elections by the end of November.

title: When Huawei Shocked America With a Smartphone
description: In this Bloomberg Originals mini-documentary, we show how the Mate 60 Pro may illustrate shortcomings in the US effort to keep China’s tech in check.

title: Biden’s ‘Organic’ Strategy for US-China Diplomacy
description: On this episode of In the City, we discuss how the US president and China’s Xi Jinping came together for a successful meeting after a long chill.

title: Biden to Lift Curbs on Chinese Forensic Lab in Fentanyl Deal
description: The US will lift restrictions on a Chinese agency accused of human-rights violations in exchange for Beijing’s planned crackdown on the fentanyl trade, according to a Biden administration official.

title: Kim Jong Un’s Daughter Marks a Year as Country’s Propaganda Star
description: A year ago, a school-age girl in a puffy white winter coat held her father’s hand to stroll past a weapon designed to obliterate an American city, and set a new course for North Korea’s propaganda apparatus.

title: How Washington’s Political Polarization Makes Compromise Harder
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior Washington correspondent Saleha Mohsin talks with former Representative Denver Riggleman about how the current political atmosphere is driving out moderates. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Xi Pledges ‘Heart-Warming’ Steps to Attract Foreign Investors
description: President Xi Jinping pledged to make it easier for foreigners to do business in China in highly-anticipated remarks delivered to a major summit, as corporate confidence wanes in the world’s second-largest economy.

title: Zelenskiy Says Shell Supply to Ukraine Slowed by Israel-Hamas War
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said the shift in focus to the Israel-Hamas war has slowed deliveries of artillery shells to Kyiv, undermining the war effort as the counteroffensive against Russia grinds to a standstill.

title: China’s Rivalry With Musk’s SpaceX Moves to Even Lower Orbit
description: China is taking its rivalry with Elon Musk’s Starlink satellites to a new level.

title: Trump Gag Order in Fraud Case Put on Hold by Appeals Court
description: A New York appeals court said the gag orders imposed on Donald Trump by the judge in the state’s civil fraud trial against him are unconstitutional, and the restrictions were put on hold pending further arguments.

title: Biden Tells Corporate Leaders Stable US-China Ties Benefit World
description: President Joe Biden said the world expects the US and China to better manage their competition, making the case for sustained US involvement in the Asia-Pacific region, a day after his high-profile meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping.

title: FDA’s Woodcock to Retire After Career Marked by Controversy
description: US Food and Drug Administration Deputy Commissioner Janet Woodcock will retire next year after nearly four decades at the regulator that were marked by controversy over support for unproven medications for rare, serious conditions.

title: US and EU Back UN Force in Postwar Gaza, Adding Pressure on Israel
description: The US and its European allies are pushing a plan to deploy an international peacekeeping force in the Gaza Strip after the war, according to people familiar with the matter, raising pressure on Israel to bring its military operation to an end as civilian casualties mount.

title: Hunt Plans UK Pension Revamp to Unlock Billions for Investment
description: British companies will be able to release billions of pounds from pension funds for investment under a package of growth reforms that Chancellor Jeremy Hunt will unveil at next week’s autumn statement.

title: Peru’s Unpopular Congress Opens Door to Creating Senate Chamber
description: A super majority of Peruvian lawmakers on Thursday approved a bill that would allow for the creation of a second chamber of congress, a move that in the long term may foster greater political stability but historically has had scant popular support nationwide.

title: Xi Is ‘Desperate’ for US Capital Amid a Slowdown, Rahm Emanuel Says
description: Xi Jinping needs US capital because of mistakes at home that have hurt China’s economic growth, the Biden administration’s outspoken ambassador to Japan said, a day after the Chinese leader met President Joe Biden and urged US executives to invest more in his country.

title: Manhattan DA Bragg Says Trump Seeks Special Treatment
description: Donald Trump’s bid to dismiss Manhattan criminal charges over hush money payments to porn star Stormy Daniels boils down to an argument that the former president deserves special treatment, prosecutors told a judge.

title: Italy Bans Lab-Grown Meat in Move to Protect Culinary Heritage
description: Italy banned the production and sale of cultivated meat, a move that signals the determination of Giorgia Meloni’s right-wing government in defending the nation’s culinary tradition.

title: Guatemala Prosecutors Open Door to Arresting President-Elect
description: Guatemala prosecutors are seeking to revoke President-elect Bernardo Arevalo’s immunity from criminal prosecution, alleging he had knowledge of a violent takeover of the University of San Carlos.

title: APEC Latest: Pro-Palestinian Protesters Halt Bay Bridge Traffic
description: The annual Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation forum saw another day of protest activity Thursday, with demonstrators in support of Palestinians halting traffic over San Francisco’s Bay Bridge.

title: US Sounds Alarm on Hungary’s Planned Crackdown on Media, NGOs
description: The US envoy to Hungary called a proposal by Prime Minister Viktor Orban to target media and civic groups potentially “very dangerous” as the nationalist leader prepares to unveil the latest crackdown on independent institutions.

title: George Santos Says He Won’t Seek Reelection to US House
description: Embattled New York Republican George Santos announced Thursday he will not run for reelection to his seat in the US House.

title: UK to Toughen Welfare Rules in Bid to Encourage Return to Work
description: The UK government will toughen the rules around claiming welfare as it tries to encourage more people to take jobs, part of an effort to boost economic growth.

title: George Santos Faces New Expulsion Pressure on Ethics Findings
description: The GOP chairman of the House’s ethics panel called Thursday for expulsion of Representative George Santos after a committee investigation found “substantial evidence” the New York Republican violated federal criminal laws.

title: Azerbaijan Snubs Peace Talks With Armenia Over US Criticism
description: Azerbaijan pulled out of planned peace talks with Armenia in Washington after it accused a senior US official of making “unacceptable” criticism of Baku’s military takeover of the Nagorno-Karabakh region.

title: Meloni Moves to Crack Down on Mafia Crime and Illegal Raves
description: The government of Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has approved tougher measures against a wide range of crimes, from scams to attacks on law and order forces.

title: UK Plans to Fast-Track Power Connections to Tackle Grid Backlog
description: The UK is planning to overhaul how it prioritizes connections to the country’s power grid, according to people familiar with the matter, part of a strategy to break the backlog that’s holding up crucial new infrastructure and placing a drag on economic growth.

title: Egypt Denies Debt Relief Offered to Accept Gaza Palestinians
description: Egypt’s foreign minister said his nation wasn’t offered help with its debts by the US and Israel in return for taking in Palestinians fleeing war-torn Gaza, a potential mass displacement the cash-strapped North African country has repeatedly rejected.

title: EU Pressures Italy to Free Lucrative Beach Licenses Cartel
description: The European Union’s executive urged Italy’s government to act after the bloc’s top court ordered the administration to open up the lucrative running of thousands of beaches to competition.

title: Ramaswamy’s Crypto Policy Calls for Deregulation and Gutting the SEC
description: Vivek Ramaswamy vows to rescind most federal cryptocurrency regulations and drastically reduce headcount at the Securities and Exchange Commission if he is elected president.

title: UK to Publish Rwanda Treaty in Days as Pressure Builds on Sunak
description: Rishi Sunak’s government will publish its new treaty with Rwanda within days, with the British prime minister under intense pressure from rebellious members of his Conservative Party to start deporting asylum seekers to the east African nation before the next general election.

title: Egypt Closes Biggest State Asset Sale of Year to Rebuild Coffers
description: Egypt’s government completed its biggest single asset sale this year by offloading a stake of about 30% in the country’s largest tobacco company, part of a privatization push aimed at raising sorely needed hard currency.

title: Israel Targets Hamas Tunnels With Attack Dogs, ‘Sponge’ Bombs
description: With Israel’s war on Hamas advancing to the heart of Gaza’s main city in a little under six weeks, the army is looking to minimize the risk of confronting another challenge: infiltrating the group’s vast, secret network of tunnels.

title: Sweden’s NATO Bid Risks Further Delay in Turkish Parliament
description: A Turkish parliamentary committee said it wants to see a written anti-terrorism road map from Sweden before approving the Nordic country’s accession to NATO, raising the prospect of further delays to the military alliance’s already drawn-out expansion plans.

title: Rebellion In The Air: Sunak And Starmer’s Separate Challenges
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: HSBC, LSE Among Firms Urging UK to Accelerate Pension Reforms
description: Top executives at HSBC Holdings Plc, London Stock Exchange and Abrdn Plc are among those urging the UK government to accelerate pension reforms to help boost investment in local businesses.

title: Germany’s Scholz to Block Erdogan’s Request to Buy Fighter Jets
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is unlikely to agree to a fresh request by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan to buy Eurofighter Typhoon jets, as tensions simmer over a number of issues including Turkey’s condemnation of Israel.

title: Canada Is So Expensive That Some Ukrainian Immigrants Are Leaving
description: High housing costs and underemployment are challenges for new arrivals

title: Spain’s Sanchez Wins New Term Thanks to Catalan Amnesty Deal
description: Pedro Sanchez won reelection as Spain’s prime minister in a confidence vote in parliament on Thursday with the backing of Catalan separatists thanks to a controversial amnesty deal.

title: Key Nigerian Union Suspends Strike After Winning Government Apology
description: Nigeria’s key labor union halted a strike affecting port and rail activities in the West African nation after it said the government apologized for an alleged assault of its president by police.

title: After $24 Billion Wipeout, Argentina’s Bonds Face Election Test
description: Bond investors have been burned repeatedly in Argentina, which has defaulted on its debt nine times since winning independence in 1816. Now, just days ahead of a crucial presidential vote, another crisis is brewing.

title: Finland Closes Key Russian Border Crossings
description: Finland will close four of its busiest border crossings with Russia after concluding that an influx of migrants from third countries was an organized operation threatening its national security.

title: Russia Detains Former Carlsberg Executives as Row Deepens
description: Russia has detained two former executives from Carlsberg A/S who managed the Baltika Brewing Co. before it was seized by the state and accused them of fraud.

title: Xi Offers a Cuddlier China to Ease US Tensions
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: African Development Bank Says Ethiopia Staff Arrested, Beaten
description: The African Development Bank said two staff members were arrested, assaulted and detained for many hours by Ethiopian security forces.

title: Musk-Xi Meeting Shows Tight Relationship China Has With Tesla
description: The cosy relationship between Elon Musk’s Tesla Inc. and China was on display again on Wednesday when President Xi Jinping expressed support for the US electric carmaker in China and Musk in turn expressed his gratitude for that warm reception.

title: Poland Wants US Firms to Buy Equity Stake in Nuclear Project, Tusk’s Aide Says
description: Poland’s incoming administration is set to pile pressure on foreign companies in the country’s nascent nuclear energy program to buy an equity stake in the venture.

title: Kenya to Send Police to Help Quell Haiti Gangs
description: Kenyan lawmakers on Thursday approved the government’s plan to deploy a police force to Haiti to rein in powerful gangs and make way for long-delayed elections.

title: US, EU Seek to Extend Steel Truce Amid Stalemate on Longer Fix
description: The US and European Union are haggling over terms to extend a truce on steel and aluminum trade to avoid the possible return of billions of dollars in tariffs on transatlantic commerce, as talks on a more lasting agreement this year have stalled.

title: China Hawk From Wisconsin Wants to Change How Wall Street Invests
description: Republican lawmaker Mike Gallagher is lobbying for comprehensive bans on key industries, instead of whack-a-mole rules in place now.

title: Lina Khan Has a Warning for the World of Private Equity
description: Roll-up strategies are in the FTC's sights.

title: Peter Thiel Is Still Hoping That Donald Trump Just Fades Away
description: The tech elite’s adventure in right-wing populism hasn’t gone quite like anyone intended.

title: Cameron Vows UK Support for Ukraine Won’t Waver in Trip to Kyiv
description: UK Foreign Secretary David Cameron chose Kyiv as the destination for his first trip abroad since returning to government and gave a personal assurance to President Volodymyr Zelenskiy that Britain will maintain support for Ukraine “for however long it takes.”

title: Hamas Chief Hiding in Gaza Tunnels Is in Israeli Crosshairs
description: Five years ago, the leader of Hamas in Gaza, Yahya Sinwar, scrawled a note on a document that he knew Egyptian intermediaries would hand to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Germany Faces Severe Rail Disruption From Train Drivers Strike
description: German rail travelers are facing massive disruption from a 20-hour strike by train drivers that began late Wednesday and is due to continue until 6 p.m. local time on Thursday.

title: Israel Latest: Biden Backs Army Raid on Gaza’s Largest Hospital
description: Israel’s military raid on Gaza’s Shifa hospital — which drew condemnation in the Middle East and elsewhere — won some support from US President Joe Biden, who said Hamas’s use of the facility against international norms constituted a “war crime.”

title: Xi Indicates China Will Once Again Send Pandas to US Zoos
description: President Xi Jinping indicated that China will renew its “Panda Diplomacy” with the US by once again sending the bears to American zoos, signaling his intent to stabilize relations between the world’s two largest economies.

title: US, Asian Nations Almost Done on Two Aspects of Economic Pact
description: The Biden administration and 13 partner nations in Asia and the Pacific are close to finishing agreements that include renewable energy and anti-corruption measures, while falling short of a deal on thornier trade issues.

title: Here’s Everything Biden, Xi Agreed to at High-Stakes Summit
description: US President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping struck a series of agreements during high-stakes talks held to stabilize a turbulent relationship strained by economic competition and military and diplomatic missteps.

title: Biden-Xi Meeting Delivers Small Wins and Promises of Better Ties
description: Presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping emerged from their first meeting in a year betting that a handful of small victories will arrest a surge in US-China tensions that has unnerved neighboring nations and threatened global economic growth.

title: Driver Arrested for Crashing Into Barricade Near Israeli Embassy in Tokyo
description: TOKYO (AP) — A vehicle crashed into a temporary barricade near the Israeli Embassy in Tokyo on Thursday, and reports say police arrested the driver.

title: Cameron, China and Confucius. It's Complicated
description: Britain’s “golden era” of ties with Beijing may look naive in retrospect, but hawkishness still needs to be balanced with pragmatism.

title: German Ruling Puts €770 Billion of Government Funding at Risk
description: Olaf Scholz, Germany's chancellor, center, flanked by Christian Lindner, Germany's finance minister, left, and Robert Habeck, Germany's economy minister, during a news conference in Berlin, Germany, on Wednesday, Nov. 8, 2023. Scholz’s advisers joined a host of other organizations in downgrading their outlook for the German economy, cutting their forecast for this year to a contraction of 0.4% and predicting a significantly weaker-than-expected recovery in 2024. Photographer: Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg

title: Xi Says China Seeks to Be Friends With US, Won’t Fight ‘Hot War’
description: President Xi Jinping said China wants to be friends with the US and said his nation won’t fight a war with anyone, one of his clearest remarks yet proclaiming a desire for peaceful ties between the world’s two largest economies.

title: US Senate Votes to Avert Shutdown, Leaves Out Israel-Ukraine Aid
description: The US Senate overwhelmingly approved a temporary funding measure to avert a government shutdown, delaying a partisan clash over federal spending until the new year and leaving out emergency aid to allies Ukraine and Israel.

title: Europe’s Elections May Delay Australia Trade Deal, Minister Says
description: A free-trade agreement between Australia and the European Union looks unlikely before Europe’s election season in mid-2024, Trade Minister Don Farrell said, pushing back any potential deal to the second half of the year.

title: Madagascar Leader Seeks New Term With Vote Credibility in Doubt
description: Madagascan President Andry Rajoelina will seek a third term in Thursday’s election, the credibility of which has been called into question even before voting started.

title: Taiwan Candidate Says He Still Hates the Party He’ll Run With
description: A top candidate for president in Taiwan says he still strongly dislikes the party he’s teaming up with, comments that suggest the partnership reshaping the race may be a rocky one.

title: Biden Backs Israel’s Hospital Raid, Hopeful on Hostage Release
description: President Joe Biden defended Israel’s military operation at Gaza’s largest hospital, standing behind the US ally in the face of international criticism of the raid.

title: Biden Again Calls Xi a Dictator, Showing Limits of Cooperation
description: US President Joe Biden said he still believed his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping was a dictator, casting a shadow over what both sides had characterized as their most productive meeting to date.

title: US, Philippine Defense Chiefs Slam China, Seek Greater Ties
description: The US and the Philippines’ defense chiefs slammed Beijing’s recent moves in the South China Sea and pushed to bolster their longstanding alliance, even as Washington seeks to warm ties with China.

title: Pentagon Fails Its Financial Audit for the Sixth Straight Year
description: The US Defense Department failed for the sixth consecutive year to score a clean financial audit, a goal routinely achieved annually by businesses that have a fraction of its $3.8 trillion in assets and $4 billion in liabilities.

title: China’s Xi Set to Meet Japan’s Kishida After a Year of Wrangling
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is set to make a fresh attempt to shore up fraught ties with China, a day after ally Joe Biden struck a warmer note at his own summit with President Xi Jinping.
